title: The Identity of Buggy and Shanks' Former Captain
theory: When Episode 8 first aired, fans theorized about the identity of the mysterious pirate captain that Buggy and Shanks served under. The flashback showed them as apprentices on the Oro Jackson, but the captain's identity was not revealed. Many fans speculated this could be a legendary pirate who would become important to the story.
author: Various One Piece fans (1999-2000)

popularity.engagement: High discussion in early One Piece fan communities

title: Rayleigh's Significance and Future Role
theory: The silver-haired man shown in the flashback (later revealed to be Silvers Rayleigh) clearly held an important position on the ship. Fans theorized that this character would return in the story and potentially have a significant role in Luffy's journey, given his connection to both Shanks and the mysterious crew.
author: Early One Piece fan communities

title: Buggy's Treasure Map Led to Something Important
theory: Some fans theorized that the treasure map Buggy lost when he fell into the ocean after eating the Devil Fruit might have led to something incredibly valuable - possibly even the One Piece itself or another legendary treasure. This would explain Buggy's intense obsession with treasure throughout the series.
author: One Piece theorists

title: Shanks Intentionally Caused Buggy to Eat the Devil Fruit
theory: A minority theory suggested that Shanks might have intentionally surprised Buggy to make him eat the Devil Fruit, either as a prank or because he knew Buggy planned something selfish. However, most fans believed it was a genuine accident based on the characters' reactions.
author: One Piece fans

title: The Oro Jackson Belonged to a Member of the Yonko or a Legendary Crew
theory: Based on the fact that both Shanks (who became a Yonko) and Buggy served as apprentices on this ship, fans theorized that the ship belonged to either a former Yonko or a legendary pirate crew that was incredibly powerful. The presence of what appeared to be high-ranking crew members supported this theory.
author: One Piece theorists
